messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-NODEJS?

ComfyUI-NODEJS allows the execution of Node.js applications within ComfyUI by leveraging a service that starts alongside ComfyUI and facilitates the installation of Node.js. It enables Python subprocesses to execute Node.js scripts.
What are some key features of ComfyUI-NODEJS?

Some key features of ComfyUI-NODEJS include a Node.js installer for Windows users, a package installer that supports the installation and automatic updating of Node.js packages, the ability to run multiple projects simultaneously, and a graceful shutdown when ComfyUI exits.

Users can install ComfyUI-NODEJS using comfy-cli by running the command 'comfy node registry-install comfyui-nodejs', or manually by cloning the GitHub repository and installing the requirements. It can also be installed using Comfy Manager within ComfyUI.
Where should Node.js projects be placed to run with ComfyUI-NODEJS?
To run Node.js projects with ComfyUI-NODEJS, the project folders should be placed in the 'nodejs' directory of ComfyUI-NODEJS, located at 'ComfyUI\custom_nodes\ComfyUI-NODEJS\nodejs'.
What files are mandatory in the root folder of each Node.js project for ComfyUI-NODEJS?

Each Node.js project should have two mandatory files in the root folder: app.js (or any other name specified in package.json) and package.json. The package.json file should include a 'production' script in the scripts object.
How can users verify that Node.js is installed successfully with ComfyUI-NODEJS?

To verify that Node.js is installed successfully with ComfyUI-NODEJS, users can open a browser and navigate to 'http://localhost:3000'. If the installation is successful, a message indicating that Node.js is running will be displayed.
Who is the developer of ComfyUI-NODEJS?
ComfyUI-NODEJS is developed by Daxton Caylor, who can be reached via Discord (daxtoncaylor) or email (daxtoncaylor@gmail.com).
